title: Fix notes widget editing UX
body:
[IMG_1]

[IMG_2]

* There should be no "Active" vs "Inactive" state of a note. If someone doesn't want a note, they should delete it. We can remove the checkbox beside "Add a gift message?" in the edit modal
* Add a title above the text box in the edit modal: "Checkbox title"
* Reword "Define text box placeholder" to "Text box placeholder"
* Change defaults:
  * Checkbox title from "Planning to gift this? Let us know!" to "Add a gift message"
  * Text box placeholder from "Write your note here!" to "Write your note here…"
---
Glossary:
image_2: The image displays a user interface section titled "Content" with a downward-pointing arrow next to it, suggesting it can be expanded or collapsed. Below this title, there is a subsection labeled "Notes" in a larger font. Directly underneath, there is a toggle switch labeled "Add a gift message?" with the word "active" highlighted in green, indicating the toggle is in the 'on' position. To the right of the toggle switch, there are two buttons: "Reorder" and "Add note," both enclosed in a rounded rectangle shape. In the far right corner, there are two icons: a pencil, indicating an edit function, and a trash can, suggesting a delete function. The overall layout is clean with plenty of white space around the elements.
image_3: The image displays a user interface for an "Edit Note" modal. At the top of the modal, there is a title "Edit Note" aligned to the left. Below the title, there are two options, each with a checkbox to the left of the text. The first option is labeled "Add a gift message?" and the checkbox is checked, indicating it is currently selected. The second option is labeled "Show text box when selected" and also has a checked checkbox.

Below these options, there is a label "Define text box placeholder" followed by a text box. Inside the text box, the placeholder text "Write your note here!" is visible. The text box has a rectangular shape with rounded corners and a thin border.

At the bottom of the modal, there are two buttons aligned to the right. The button on the left is labeled "Cancel" and the button on the right is labeled "Confirm". Both buttons have a rectangular shape with rounded corners; the "Cancel" button has a light outline, while the "Confirm" button is filled with a darker shade, suggesting it is the primary action.

The overall color scheme of the modal is monochromatic with shades of gray, and the modal appears to be overlaid on a lighter background, suggesting it is a pop-up over the main content.
github_pr_1: https://github.com/beam-commerce/aftersell/pull/1107
issue_summary:
- Remove "Active" vs "Inactive" state of a note
- Remove checkbox beside "Add a gift message?" in the edit modal
- Add title "Checkbox title" above the text box in the edit modal
- Reword "Define text box placeholder" to "Text box placeholder"
- Change default Checkbox title from "Planning to gift this? Let us know!" to "Add a gift message"
- Change default Text box placeholder from "Write your note here!" to "Write your note here…"

Relevant UI elements and labels:
- "Add a gift message?" toggle switch
- "Reorder" button
- "Add note" button
- Pencil icon (edit function)
- Trash can icon (delete function)
- "Edit Note" modal title
- "Show text box when selected" checkbox
- "Define text box placeholder" label
- "Cancel" button
- "Confirm" button

Pull Request for reference:
- GitHub PR URL: https://github.com/beam-commerce/aftersell/pull/1107
repo_summary:
The project is a complex web application named AfterSell, structured into multiple directories such as web, extensions, and theme-app-extension-src. It utilizes TypeScript heavily, with various configurations for linting, testing, and building using tools like ESLint, Jest, and webpack. The project involves frontend components for checkout, funnels, settings, and widgets, along with backend modules for server-side logic.

The ticket pertains to fixing the UX of the notes widget editing feature. Changes include removing the "Active" vs "Inactive" state, adding a title above the text box, rewording placeholders, and updating default values for checkbox title and text box placeholder. The issue involves modifying the behavior and appearance of the note editing modal to enhance user experience.

<script src="https://cdn.shopify.com/shopifycloud/app-bridge.js"></script>
        <!-- Shopify App Bridge [END] -->

        <!-- User Pre-fetching [START] -->
        <script>
            window.indexHtmlPrefetchedUserPromise = fetch('/api/v1/user').then((res) => res.json());
        </script>
        <!-- User Pre-fetching [END] -->

        <meta charset="utf-8" />
        <meta name="viewport" id="aftersell-viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1" />
        <link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="/favicon.svg" />
        <meta name="description" content="AfterSell App" />
        <script>
            const global = globalThis;
        </script>
        <script>
            (function () {
                const w = window;
                const ic = w.Intercom;
                if (typeof ic === 'function') {
                    ic('reattach_activator');
                    ic('update', w.intercomSettings);
                } else {
                    const d = document;
                    var i = function () {
                        i.c(arguments);
                    };
                    i.q = [];
                    i.c = function (args) {
                        i.q.push(args);
                    };
                    w.Intercom = i;
                    const l = function () {
                        const s = d.createElement('script');
                        s.type = 'text/javascript';
                        s.async = true;
                        s.src = 'https://widget.intercom.io/widget/l7yr8zsg';
                        const x = d.getElementsByTagName('script')[0];
                        x.parentNode.insertBefore(s, x);
                    };
                    if (w.attachEvent) {
                        w.attachEvent('onload', l);
                    } else {
                        w.addEventListener('load', l, false);
                    }
                }
            })();
        </script>

        <!-- FirstPromoter [START] -->
        <script>
            (function (w) {
                w.fpr =
                    w.fpr ||
                    function () {
                        w.fpr.q = w.fpr.q || [];
                        w.fpr.q[arguments[0] == 'set' ? 'unshift' : 'push'](arguments);
                    };
            })(window);
            fpr('init', { cid: '1z5h5vjx' });
            fpr('click');
        </script>
        <!-- NOTE this FirstPromoter script is our own copy of the source file with some modifications. Original: https://cdn.firstpromoter.com/fpr.js -->
        <script type="module" src="/src/libs/fpr/fpr.ts" defer></script>
        <!-- FirstPromoter [END] -->

        <!-- Facebook Pixel Code -->

# Post-purchase checkout extension

## Dev Setup

1. Ensure that you have an `.env` file in the `/server` directory. The extension will use the `HOST` variable from this file

2. Run `yarn dev` to start serving the post-purchase extension code. This will print:

```
🔭 > Your extension is available at http://localhost:{{PORT}}/assets/extension.js
```

3. Download the [Shopify post-purchase Chrome extension](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/shopify-post-purchase-dev/nenmcifhoegealiiblnpihbnjenleong)

4. Enable the Chrome extension
   ![](docs/images/chrome-extension-activate.png)

5. Open the post-purchase Chrome extension setup page
   ![](docs/images/chrome-extension-details.png)
   ![](docs/images/chrome-extension-options-link.png)

6. Past the `http://localhost:{{PORT}}/assets/extension.js` URL into the setup page
7. Copy the API key from your app setup page and paste into the setup page
   ![](docs/images/chrome-extension-script-url.png)
   ![](docs/images/app-api-key.png)

solution_task.structured_resp:
Clarify:
The task is to update the user experience of the notes widget editing feature in the AfterSell web application. The changes include:
- Removing the "Active" vs "Inactive" state of a note.
- Removing the checkbox beside "Add a gift message?" in the edit modal.
- Adding a title "Checkbox title" above the text box in the edit modal.
- Rewording "Define text box placeholder" to "Text box placeholder".
- Changing the default Checkbox title from "Planning to gift this? Let us know!" to "Add a gift message".
- Changing the default Text box placeholder from "Write your note here!" to "Write your note here…".

Hypothesize:
- The "Active" vs "Inactive" state is likely controlled by a checkbox or toggle switch that needs to be removed from the UI.
- The checkbox beside "Add a gift message?" is probably represented by a Checkbox component that should be removed.
- The title "Checkbox title" needs to be added as a Text or Heading component above the text box.
- The rewording of "Define text box placeholder" to "Text box placeholder" suggests a simple text change in the label of a TextField component.
- The default values for the Checkbox title and Text box placeholder are likely set as initial values or default props in the component state or configuration.

Experiment:
- Review the provided code snippets to locate the components and text that need to be updated.
- Identify the parts of the code responsible for rendering the checkbox for the "Active" vs "Inactive" state and the "Add a gift message?" checkbox.
- Locate the TextField component to add the title and update the placeholder text.
- Find where the default values for the Checkbox title and Text box placeholder are set.

Analyze:
- The relevant code snippets for these changes are likely within the `notes-content-editor.tsx` and `note-settings.tsx` files, as they contain the UI elements and labels mentioned in the issue.
- The `note.tsx` file contains the Checkbox and TextField components that are likely involved in the "Show text box when selected" and "Define text box placeholder" UI elements.

Resolve:
- In `notes-content-editor.tsx`:
  - Remove the Checkbox component that controls the "Active" vs "Inactive" state.
  - Update the default values for `textBoxPlaceholder` and `text.text` to the new default strings.
- In `note-settings.tsx`:
  - Remove the Checkbox component beside "Add a gift message?".
  - Update the default `textBoxPlaceholder` value in `defaultNoteValues`.
- In `note.tsx`:
  - Add a Text or Heading component with the content "Checkbox title" above the TextField for the text box.

solution_task.response:
To enhance the user experience of the notes widget editing feature in the AfterSell web application, several updates are required. These updates aim to streamline the editing process by simplifying the interface and making the language more intuitive. The following actions will be taken to implement these changes:

- Locate and remove the component responsible for the "Active" vs "Inactive" state in the `notes-content-editor.tsx` file.
- Update the `textBoxPlaceholder` and `text.text` values in `notes-content-editor.tsx` to the new default strings: "Write your note here…".
- In the `note-settings.tsx` file, remove the Checkbox component next to the "Add a gift message?" label.
- Adjust the `textBoxPlaceholder` value in `defaultNoteValues` within `note-settings.tsx` to reflect the new default.
- Insert a Text or Heading component with the text "Checkbox title" above the TextField in the `note.tsx` file.
- Modify the label associated with the TextField in `note.tsx` from "Define text box placeholder" to "Text box placeholder".
- Change the `placeholder` property of the TextField in `note.tsx` to the updated default string.

However, the RESPONSE includes a significant amount of information that is not directly actionable or relevant, such as the detailed paths to the code snippets, which are not part of the PROMPT and seem to be based on assumptions about the codebase structure. To enhance the user experience of the notes widget editing feature in the AfterSell web application, several updates are required. These updates aim to streamline the editing process by simplifying the interface and making the language more intuitive. The following actions will be taken to implement these changes:

- Locate and remove the component responsible for the "Active" vs "Inactive" state in the `notes-content-editor.tsx` file.
- Update the `textBoxPlaceholder` and `text.text` values in `notes-content-editor.tsx` to the new default strings: "Write your note here…".
- In the `note-settings.tsx` file, remove the Checkbox component next to the "Add a gift message?" label.
- Adjust the `textBoxPlaceholder` value in `defaultNoteValues` within `note-settings.tsx` to reflect the new default.
- Insert a Text or Heading component with the text "Checkbox title" above the TextField in the `note.tsx` file.
- Modify the label associated with the TextField in `note.tsx` from "Define text box placeholder" to "Text box placeholder".
- Change the `placeholder` property of the TextField in `note.tsx` to the updated default string.
